2018-10-07T05:05:01Z: Driver, TeamLewis Hamilton, MercedesValterri Bottas, MercedesMax Verstappen, Red BullDaniel Ricciardo, Red BullKimi Raikkonen, FerrariSebastian Vettel, FerrariSergio Perez, Force IndiaRomain Grosjean, HaasEsteban Ocon, Force IndiaCarlos Sainz, Renault
2018-10-07T06:59:42Z: With the podium ceremony complete, we're going to bow out and leave you with our full Japanese GP report. Thanks for joining us nice and early for today's race, and keep up with all the reaction from the paddock this afternoon with Autosport and Motorsport.com. Japanese Grand Prix: Hamilton wins, Vettel clashes with VerstappenLewis Hamilton moved to the brink of the 2018 Formula 1 title by claiming victory in the Japanese Grand Prix as Sebastian Vettel clashed with Max Verstappen
2018-10-07T06:46:06Z: Final order: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas; 3 Verstappen; 4 Ricciardo; 5 Raikkonen; 6 Vettel; 7 Perez; 8 Grosjean; 9 Ocon; 10 Sainz; 11 Gasly; 12 Ericsson; 13 Hartley; 14 Alonso; 15 Vandoorne; 16 Sirotkin; 17 Stroll; DNF Leclerc; DNF Hulkenberg; DNF Magnussen
2018-10-07T06:43:22Z: Perez, Grosjean and Ocon all finished on the lead lap in seventh, eighth and ninth, while Sainz completes the points.
2018-10-07T06:42:30Z: Vettel sets another new fastest lap on the final lap, but he finishes only sixth.
2018-10-07T06:42:12Z: Raikkonen's pace at the end was very slow, but he doesn't slow so much that team orders are employed and crosses the line fifth.
2018-10-07T06:41:25Z: Bottas successfully fends off Verstappen for third.
2018-10-07T06:41:08Z: Hamilton crosses the line to win the Japanese Grand Prix and take another big step towards his fifth world championship.
2018-10-07T06:40:46Z: Vettel pinches fastest lap from Hamilton.
2018-10-07T06:40:40Z: Verstappen is giving this everything, but has quite a big lock-up into the hairpin. That gives Bottas some breathing space again.
2018-10-07T06:38:15Z: Hamilton sets a fastest lap of 1m32.785s, just because he can. His lead is 11.5s as he begins his penultimate lap.
2018-10-07T06:37:43Z: Verstappen has got the gap to Bottas below two seconds again, but with three laps left the Mercedes one-two now looks pretty safe after that brief period of tension.
2018-10-07T06:37:16Z: Sainz gets by Gasly for the final point on the run to Turn 1 with three laps to go.
2018-10-07T06:35:48Z: Grosjean hasn't stuck to target and is now outside the five-second window to Perez ahead. He's still got his mirrors full of Ocon.
2018-10-07T06:34:49Z: No sign of Ferrari doing anything to get Vettel ahead of Raikkonen yet - that gap remains 35s.
2018-10-07T06:33:55Z: Toro Rossos started the race from sixth and seventh, but the team faces a bit of a sweat to hang on to a point here. Sainz, who ran longest of all, is just half a second behind Gasly in the fight for 10th now.
2018-10-07T06:33:26Z: Bottas tidies things up and gets his gap to Verstappen back over a second.
2018-10-07T06:32:42Z: But now Bottas brakes too late into the chicane and runs wide, skittering over the kerbs and that's let Verstappen right back onto his tail!
2018-10-07T06:31:15Z: Promoted: For the latest odds and offers, download the Pitstop Betting app and play along today
2018-10-07T06:31:11Z: Top six gaps: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +9.9s; 3 Verstappen +11.7s; 4 Ricciardo +18.4s; 5 Raikkonen +29.5s; 6 Vettel +1m07.3s
2018-10-07T06:30:26Z: Bottas appears to have his medium tyres back in shape - he sets the fastest first sector of the race so far and is back up to 1.6s clear of Verstappen.
2018-10-07T06:30:13Z: Rather than keeping up with Perez, Grosjean is slowly falling into the clutches of Ocon. The second Force India is now within a second of the Haas.
2018-10-07T06:29:12Z: Bottas and Verstappen successfully lap Ericsson's Sauber into the chicane. The Mercedes' straightline speed advantage means Verstappen will have to do something creative to get past.
2018-10-07T06:28:32Z: Verstappen is now just half a second behind Bottas, who seems to be in real tyre trouble and has fallen 9s away from race-leading team-mate Hamilton.
2018-10-07T06:27:27Z: Alonso, who is 14th, claims he lost four seconds while being lapped by Bottas and Verstappen.
2018-10-07T06:25:28Z: Ricciardo has just set a new fastest race lap too, can he join team-mate Verstappen's battle with Bottas? He's 4.3s behind.
2018-10-07T06:25:24Z: Perez got around the Haas at the chicane, with Grosjean immediately on the radio (quelle surprise) to insist he had stuck to the delta under the VSC and deserves the place back.
2018-10-07T06:25:01Z: Bottas locks up into the hairpin and runs wide as he laps Alonso, and that allows Verstappen to get very, very close to him...
2018-10-07T06:24:22Z: Perez has, somewhere, managed to get by Grosjean for seventh.
2018-10-07T06:23:28Z: Williams decided to pit Sirotkin and Stroll again and has fitted both with supersofts.
2018-10-07T06:22:59Z: Verstappen is now under a second behind Bottas with 12 laps left.
2018-10-07T06:22:38Z: But both Hamilton and Bottas stay out as the VSC ends.
2018-10-07T06:22:25Z: Mercedes looks like it's making a pitstop...
2018-10-07T06:22:01Z: Replays show the Sauber simply ran wide out off Denger 1 into the gravel.
2018-10-07T06:21:35Z: The virtual safety car is called while Leclerc is retrieved.
2018-10-07T06:20:34Z: Verstappen is now under 2s behind Bottas as they nip between the traffic.
2018-10-07T06:20:13Z: Leclerc has gone off at Degner 2 and is rejoining very gingerly.
2018-10-07T06:18:52Z: Hulkenberg is in the pits for a second time, but has been wheeled back into the Renault garage.
2018-10-07T06:17:47Z: Verstappen has been quizzing Red Bull in depth about tyre compounds' wear life, as his soft-shod Red Bull keeps on edging closer to Bottas's medium-shod Mercedes. That gap is just 2.2s now.
2018-10-07T06:14:18Z: Good timing. Leclerc comes in for a second stop and swaps back to softs.
2018-10-07T06:13:39Z: Gasly clears Leclerc for 10th into the chicane. Big blister marks on the Sauber's left-rear medium tyre now.
2018-10-07T06:13:26Z: With no more pitstops expected barring sudden surprise tyre collapsing, Vettel's only hope of getting higher than sixth is either trouble ahead or Ferrari asking Raikkonen to dramatically slow.
2018-10-07T06:12:24Z: Vettel picks off Grosjean into Spoon, so is now back up to sixth. He's 40 seconds behind Raikkonen, though, so that might be the extent of his recovery.
2018-10-07T06:11:54Z: The Red Bulls are lapping nearly a second quicker than the Mercedes now, but this is surely a case of the champion team just controlling the pace with 19 laps left.
2018-10-07T06:10:53Z: Now in clear-ish air, Vettel sets a new fastest lap of the race - a 1m33.243s.
2018-10-07T06:10:07Z: Vettel has now passed the leading Force India of Perez and puts in a fastest first sector of all for good measure. He's now seventh.
2018-10-07T06:09:35Z: Good move from Gasly around the outside of Ericsson on the run to Turn 1. That promotes him to 11th after Sainz's stop.
2018-10-07T06:08:53Z: Sainz, who was the only driver yet to pit, now comes in from sixth to make his stop.
2018-10-07T06:08:24Z: Gasly's team-mate Brendon Hartley has fared even worse, and is down in 16th having started sixth.
2018-10-07T06:07:40Z: Gasly has pitted and is going to have to perform similar overtaking feats to the Force Indias to work his way back up the order. He's back out in 13th on softs.
2018-10-07T06:06:48Z: Vettel gets the better of the squabbling Leclerc and Ocon and is up to ninth.
2018-10-07T06:06:02Z: While the midfield is providing plenty of wild racing, it's pretty static up front: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +5.5s; 3 Verstappen +13.2s; 4 Ricciardo +16.6s; 5 Raikkonen +21.1s
2018-10-07T06:05:36Z: Haas just gets Grosjean back out in front of Perez! A lap under the wing of Leclerc's Sauber hampered the Force India driver's charge and, as he pulled out of the slipstream on the run to Turn 1, Grosjean emerged from the pits to preserve his Class B lead.
2018-10-07T06:04:26Z: Things get worse for Hulkenberg, who's now passed by Vettel at the chicane.
2018-10-07T06:03:34Z: Good move from Leclerc on the run to the chicane, who slithers up the inside of Hulkenberg. That compromises Hulkenberg's exit, allowing Perez - who's made excellent progress since his stop - to mug the Renault as well!
2018-10-07T06:02:26Z: Vettel has a go around the outside of Sirotkin for 15th but can't make it stick, before passing the Williams on the inside on the run to Spoon.
2018-10-07T06:01:24Z: Ocon rejoined in 15th on mediums, one place ahead of Vettel (who took softs).
2018-10-07T06:00:39Z: Prior to his stop, Vettel had been struggling to make an impression on the back of Sainz. He can still salvage something from the race, but it looks like there's a long, frustrating second half of the race to come for the Ferrari man.
2018-10-07T05:59:17Z: Vettel now stops, following the second Force India of Ocon into the pits.
2018-10-07T05:59:13Z: Hamilton is still complaining of minor problems and odd feelings in his car. But he's still holding a secure 4.6s lead over Bottas.
2018-10-07T05:58:40Z: Perez has stopped and has rejoined in 17th, which has promoted Vettel back into the points.
2018-10-07T05:58:03Z: Replays now showing the incident between Stroll and Alonso. Stroll squeezed the McLaren off the track  at the final chicane, but Alonso decided to carry on into the runoff and cleared the Williams via a trip through the gravel. Penalties probably fair in both instances.
2018-10-07T05:57:27Z: Nearly at half-distance, pitstops probably done, here's the lead group: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +4.5s; 3 Verstappen +15.4s; 4 Ricciardo +16.7s; 5 Raikkonen +21.3s
2018-10-07T05:55:34Z: Smooth stop from Hamilton and he rejoins still leading Bottas.
2018-10-07T05:55:10Z: Both Bottas and Ricciardo took on medium tyres in their pitstops, and Hamilton will do the same.
2018-10-07T05:54:55Z: Hamilton now pits from the lead.
2018-10-07T05:54:44Z: Pitting early and taking on mediums hasn't gone Raikkonen any good - he's fallen away from Verstappen and been jumped by the flying Ricciardo too.
2018-10-07T05:54:20Z: Verstappen sets the fastest lap and sweeps past just as Ricciardo rejoins, with both Red Bulls now ahead of Raikkonen.
2018-10-07T05:53:41Z: Ricciardo pits from third as well.
2018-10-07T05:53:35Z: Raikkonen is past Grosjean and into fifth.
2018-10-07T05:53:16Z: The stewards say they won't be taking any action over the Verstappen/Vettel collision.
2018-10-07T05:52:31Z: Verstappen rejoined behind the yet-to-pit Grosjean but storms past the Haas into the 130R to reclaim fourth.
2018-10-07T05:52:10Z: Red Bull tells Ricciardo he's now right on the cusp of rejoining ahead of Raikkonen when he pits.
2018-10-07T05:51:49Z: Bottas's turn to set fastest lap, but Hamilton then takes it straight back again with a 1m34.183s and is now 5s clear.
2018-10-07T05:51:31Z: Alonso has been given a five-second penalty for leaving the track and gaining an advantage, while Stroll also has a penalty for causing a collision.
2018-10-07T05:50:38Z: Vettel is now back within sight of the points, having cleared Hartley. He's around half a second behind Sainz.
2018-10-07T05:50:31Z: Verstappen comes in for his pitstop - which will include his 5s penalty for rejoining unsafely earlier.
2018-10-07T05:50:04Z: Raikkonen had a good run on Perez through 130R but avoided taking a look into the chicane. Instead, he lines the Force India up on the straight and picks off another midfielder.
2018-10-07T05:49:27Z: Another new fastest lap from Hamilton and his lead hits 4.5s over Bottas.
2018-10-07T05:48:12Z: Raikkonen gets by Ocon now on the start/finish straight.
2018-10-07T05:47:56Z: Vettel has also passed Alonso for 12th, having drafted the McLaren on the run to Turn 1.
2018-10-07T05:47:22Z: Raikkonen passed Sainz on his outlap and is immediately on the tail of Ocon for eighth.
2018-10-07T05:47:11Z: Hamilton's lead over Bottas is just past 4s as they go onto lap 20 of 53.
2018-10-07T05:46:53Z: Ricciardo is catching team-mate Verstappen for third at quite a rate now, but with nearly 9s between them still it looks unlikely that the #3 Red Bull will benefit from the #33's penalty.
2018-10-07T05:44:44Z: So now the 'Class B' cars are effectively in their natural positions, Grosjean has a margin of around 1.3s over Gasly at the head of that battle. Perez is 1.7s back, Ocon trails his team-mate by 1.2s while Sainz - who runs 10th having passed Hartley - is within 2s of the Force Indias.
2018-10-07T05:43:09Z: Vettel has a dive past Hulkenberg into the chicane to claim another position.
2018-10-07T05:42:23Z: Promoted: For all the latest odds and offers, download the Pitstop Betting app and play along today
2018-10-07T05:41:37Z: Vettel gets ahead of Leclerc and is 14th. The Renault of Hulkenberg, then Alonso's McLaren, are next up for the Ferrari.
2018-10-07T05:40:26Z: Ricciardo is catching Raikkonen for fourth at a second per lap at the moment.
2018-10-07T05:40:11Z: Raikkonen says his Ferrari is struggling on left-hand corners. Could that be connected to the bodywork lost when he made contact with Verstappen?
2018-10-07T05:38:52Z: Lead gaps now: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +2.8s; 3 Verstappen +5.3s; 4 Raikkonen +8.8s; 5 Ricciardo +15.7s
2018-10-07T05:38:38Z: Vettel clears Stroll - who'd earlier been passed by Leclerc - for 15th, so once again sets after his 2019 team-mate.
2018-10-07T05:38:04Z: Ricciardo does his chicane dive again and takes fifth from Grosjean. That's 15th to fifth in 14 laps for the Red Bull.
2018-10-07T05:36:45Z: Ricciardo deploys the DRS and sweeps past Gasly into sixth. Next up will be Grosjean.
2018-10-07T05:36:22Z: Vettel has also cleared Sirotkin, so Leclerc is his next target.
2018-10-07T05:35:24Z: Vettel has a go at getting past Ericsson out of the chicane, can't quite manage it on traction, but then clears the Sauber on the run to Turn 1.
2018-10-07T05:34:59Z: Ricciardo couldn't quite make it past Perez on the straight, so takes a lunge at the chicane instead. He succeeds and is up to seventh. Next target is Gasly, who you'd expect to be friendly.
2018-10-07T05:34:03Z: Vettel is back in 18th, chasing down Ericsson and Sirotkin - who have both pitted for mediums.
2018-10-07T05:33:17Z: Grosjean has a bit of a cushion back to Gasly in the battle for fifth, with Perez and Ricciardo tucked up right behind the Toro Rosso.
2018-10-07T05:32:53Z: Bizarre replay from the moments before the restart, which show Ericsson having a bit of a lazy moment and running into the back of Leclerc.
2018-10-07T05:32:49Z: Verstappen has shaken Raikkonen off again but is 2.5s behind the Mercedes.
2018-10-07T05:32:33Z: Hamilton sets another new fastest lap of 1m34.346s and extends his lead over Bottas to 2.5s.
2018-10-07T05:32:15Z: Ricciardo is now up with next target Perez for seventh.
2018-10-07T05:32:02Z: Bad day for Magnussen, who's back in the pits and being wheeled into the Haas garage.
2018-10-07T05:31:13Z: The Verstappen/Vettel collision is now under investigation.
2018-10-07T05:30:49Z: We haven't seen it on-screen, but Ricciardo has found a way past Ocon and is up to eighth.
2018-10-07T05:30:46Z: Vettel felt there was enough of a gap to have a look down the inside at Spoon, Verstappen turned in, they made contact and the Ferrari spun off onto the run-off with a bit of debris flying.
2018-10-07T05:29:46Z: No further action in the incident between Magussen and Leclerc.
2018-10-07T05:29:42Z: That gives Raikkonen a run at Verstappen for third again but there's no space for him to get through at the chicane.
2018-10-07T05:29:21Z: Vettel has a go at Verstappen for third into Spoon, they touch and Vettel spins!
2018-10-07T05:28:52Z: Vettel had a slight look at Verstappen's third place into the first corner at the restart but didn't have a realistic chance.
2018-10-07T05:28:18Z: Hamilton keeps the lead with no trouble at all at the restart.
2018-10-07T05:28:00Z: Gasly reports a fire on Grosjean's car.
2018-10-07T05:27:47Z: Hamilton backs the pack up long before the 130R and is now weaving before going for it.
2018-10-07T05:27:04Z: With Magnussen having been let through to unlap himself, this will be the final lap behind the safety car.
2018-10-07T05:25:44Z: Magnussen has been cleared to unlap himself and race round to the back of the safety car train.
2018-10-07T05:23:36Z: The incident between Leclerc and Magnussen is being review by the stewards.
2018-10-07T05:23:27Z: Verstappen's penalty will be taken at his first pitstop, which means Vettel should leap past him into third at that point.
2018-10-07T05:22:57Z: That penalty for Verstappen is for the incident with Raikkonen where he clashed with the Ferrari as he rejoined after running off at the chicane.
2018-10-07T05:22:00Z: Sauber mechanics are out in the pitlane, preparing to change Leclerc's front wing. He takes a set of mediums. Sirotkin has also been in to switch to the mediums.
2018-10-07T05:20:51Z: Order under safety car: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas; 3 Verstappen; 4 Vettel; 5 Raikkonen; 6 Grosjean; 7 Gasly; 8 Perez; 9 Ocon; 10 Ricciardo; 11 Hartley; 12 Sainz; 13 Leclerc; 14 Alonso; 15 Hulkenberg; 16 Stroll; 17 Ericsson; 18 Sirotkin; 19 Vandoorne; 20 Magnussen
2018-10-07T05:19:30Z: A replay of the start shows Vettel jumped both Toro Rossos very quickly as he got off the line. Gasly did a strong job to hang on around the outside of Turns 1 and 2, but then had to give the place up.
2018-10-07T05:18:52Z: The safety car has been deployed because of Magnussen's debris.
2018-10-07T05:18:36Z: Ricciardo now gets around the outside of Hartley at Spoon and is up into the top 10.
2018-10-07T05:18:16Z: Race control says it is investigating the contact between Raikkonen and Verstappen.
2018-10-07T05:17:53Z: Ricciardo has made good progress in the opening laps and is up to 11th from 15th.
2018-10-07T05:17:30Z: Hamilton now leads Bottas by 2.5s on lap three, with Verstappen another 2s back in third.
2018-10-07T05:17:27Z: Puncture for Magnussen, who's struggling back round the lap. Replays show he moved over on the straight to defend from Leclerc, who had little option but to run into the back of the Haas.
2018-10-07T05:16:24Z: Raikkonen wasn't even looking at Verstappen that realistically, but the Red Bull locked up on its own, went onto the grass, bumped over the kerbs and then bumped into Raikkonen. Vettel wasted no time in getting between them.
2018-10-07T05:16:15Z: So Grosjean remains in the 'Class B' lead fro Gasly, while the Force Indas of Perez and Ocon are eighth and ninth and Hartley - who started sixth - has already shipped four places from his start spot.
2018-10-07T05:15:44Z: Raikkonen takes a look at Verstappen on the outside into the chicane, Verstappen runs wide and then defends heavily and bangs wheels with the Ferrari. Vettel sweeps past his team-mate into fourth!
2018-10-07T05:15:06Z: Vettel forces his way past Grosjean into fifth at the kink between the hairpin and Spoon - very forceful and very effective.
2018-10-07T05:14:26Z: So it's Hamilton leading from Bottas, Verstappen, Raikkonen, Grosjean and Vettel is ahead of Gasly in sixth.
2018-10-07T05:14:05Z: Hamilton moves across and covers Bottas, Vettel looks like he's cleared the Toro Rossos by the first corner.
2018-10-07T05:13:36Z: The lights begin to come on...
2018-10-07T05:13:23Z: Qualifying crasher Marcus Ericsson pulls up to complete the grid.
2018-10-07T05:12:41Z: Hamilton leads the field back onto the grid.
2018-10-07T05:12:33Z: Will today live up to its promise for Toro Rosso and Honda? Team boss Franz Tost declared the team had to be in Q3 with the upgraded engine - Brendon Hartley and Pierre Gasly start an outstanding sixth and seventh.
2018-10-07T05:12:00Z: Vettel was only ninth fastest in qualifying, but was then given one place back when Ocon was given a three-place grid penalty for driving too fast under a red flag situation in final practice.
2018-10-07T05:10:50Z: Vettel isn't the only frontrunner who has to come through the field today - Daniel Ricciardo's actuator failure at the start of Q2 yesterday left him 15th on the grid.
2018-10-07T05:10:25Z: The formation lap begins, everyone away cleanly.
2018-10-07T05:09:44Z: Here's the full grid line-up and their tyre choices:1 Hamilton (S)2 Bottas (S)3 Verstappen (SS)4 Raikkonen (SS)5 Grosjean (S)6 Hartley (SS)7 Gasly (SS)8 Vettel (SS)9 Perez (SS)10 Leclerc (S)11 Ocon (SS)12 Magnussen (S)13 Sainz (S)14 Stroll (S)15 Ricciardo (S)16 Hulkenberg (M)17 Sirotkin (S)18 Alonso (S)19 Vandoorne (S)20 Ericsson (S)
2018-10-07T05:03:44Z: Don't expect the weather to shake anything up, though - it's dry and sunny at Suzuka this afternoon.
2018-10-07T05:03:26Z: We have an all-Mercedes front row, and Sebastian Vettel down in eighth after a terrible qualifying session for Ferrari. On paper, this race looks like it will be another day of Lewis Hamilton crushing Vettel's title hopes, but there are a lot of laps to unfold yet.
2018-10-07T05:02:17Z: Hello and welcome to our live coverage of the Japanese Grand Prix.
